result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trevor James Wilson

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

OFF RECORD 11:20 AM Defendant Trevor James Wilson not in court.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson in court for Trevor James Wilson.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Def Atty states that DEF is in prison. Court Resets for a Status Conference. Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.

OFF THE RECORD / 3:07 PM Defendant Trevor James Wilson not in court.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson in court for Trevor James Wilson.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin.   Attny Anderson request adjournment recently appointed to all cases.  Court reset.
Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on September 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on June 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

11:14AM Defendant Trevor James Wilson in court, appearing by video from in custody in Sawyer County Jail, with attorney Fredric B. Anderson, appearing by video.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Atty Anderson acknowledges information, waives reading, enters NG plea on behalf of DEF.  DEF agrees.  Court enters NG pleas, finds probable cause, and binds DEF over for trial.  Court sets STC for 6/7/22 at 2:30PM.  Status conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
State's Discovery Demand_1 - Wilson, Trevor James

03:46 PM Defendant Trevor James Wilson in court with attorney Fredric B. Anderson appears by video.  Defendant Trevor James Wilson in custody appears by video.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court calls case and recites appearances.  Atty Anderson indicates DEF waives preliminary hearing.  Court advised the DEF as to his right to prelim.  DEF does not wish to have prelim.  Court finds defendant freely waived his right to prelim finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  Arraignment scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: SIGNATURE BOND RETURNED FROM JAIL MARKED REFUSED AS DEFENDANT REFUSED TO SIGN BOND.
Preliminary hearing on February 15, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

03:02 PM Defendant Trevor James Wilson in court with attorney Fredric B. Anderson appears by video.  Defendant Trevor James Wilson in custody appears by video.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court calls case and recites appearances.  DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  Attny Anderson request preliminary hearing within time limits.  Off the record for scheduling.   
Back on the Record:   State request bond.   SIBS $10,000  COMBINED BOND  22CF17 and 22CF23    no contacts to be added at next hearing.  DEF on a probation hold.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 15, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
